etymologies: Old English otr, ot(t)or, of Germanic origin; related to Greek hudros ‘water snake’

definitions: a semiaquatic fish-eating mammal of the weasel family, with an elongated body, dense fur, and webbed feet.

notes.text: Lutra and other genera, family Mustelidae: several species, including the river otter (L. canadensis). See also sea otter

shortDefinitions: semiaquatic fish-eating mammal of weasel family, with elongated body, dense fur, and webbed feet
